item.text: “‘Now if his offering is a peace-offering sacrifice, if he presents an offering from the herd, he must present before the Lord a flawless male or a female.

He must <st data-num="05564" class="">lay</st> his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> of his <st data-num="07133" class="">offering</st> and <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughter</st> it at the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> of the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st>, and the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st>, the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>, must <st data-num="02236" class="">splash</st> the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar’s</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">sides</st>.<n id="1" />
Then the one presenting the offering must present a gift to the Lord from the peace-offering sacrifice: He must remove the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that surrounds the entrails,

the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03629" class="">kidneys</st> with the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> their <st data-num="03689" class="">sinews</st>, and the <st data-num="03508" class="">protruding lobe</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="03516" class="">liver</st> (which he is to <st data-num="05493" class="">remove</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">along with</st> the <st data-num="03629" class="">kidneys</st>).<n id="1" />
Then the sons of Aaron must offer it up in smoke on the altar atop the burnt offering that is on the wood in the fire as a gift of a soothing aroma to the Lord.
“‘If his offering for a peace-offering sacrifice to the Lord is from the flock, he must present a flawless male or female.
If he presents a sheep as his offering, he must present it before the Lord.

He must <st data-num="05564" class="">lay</st> his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> of his <st data-num="07133" class="">offering</st> and <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughter</st> it <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st>, and the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> must <st data-num="02236" class="">splash</st><n id="1" /> its <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar’s</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">sides</st>.

Then he must present a gift to the Lord from the peace-offering sacrifice: He must remove all the fatty tail up to the end of the spine, the fat covering the entrails, and all the fat on the entrails,

the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03629" class="">kidneys</st> with the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> their <st data-num="03689" class="">sinews</st>, and the <st data-num="03508" class="">protruding lobe</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="03516" class="">liver</st> (which he is to <st data-num="05493" class="">remove</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">along with</st> the <st data-num="03629" class="">kidneys</st>).<n id="1" />
Then the priest must offer it up in smoke on the altar as a food gift to the Lord.
“‘If his offering is a goat, he must present it before the Lord,

<st data-num="05564" class="">lay</st> his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> its <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st>, and <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughter</st> it <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st>, and the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> must <st data-num="02236" class="">splash</st> its <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar’s</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">sides</st>.
Then he must present from it his offering as a gift to the Lord: the fat which covers the entrails and all the fat on the entrails,

the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03629" class="">kidneys</st> with the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> their <st data-num="03689" class="">sinews</st>, and the <st data-num="03508" class="">protruding lobe</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="03516" class="">liver</st> (which he is to <st data-num="05493" class="">remove</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">along with</st> the <st data-num="03629" class="">kidneys</st>).<n id="1" />
Then the priest must offer them up in smoke on the altar as a food gift for a soothing aroma—all the fat belongs to the Lord.
This is a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all the places where you live: You must never eat any fat or any blood.’”
